title: Stuck on reconnecting screen
body: Ive been stuck on reconnecting screen after my game has finished when my game randomly dced and i cant get back onto normal home screen pls help

replies.body: Some people say you just have to wait it out but i dont think it is working cause ive been waiting for an hour yet and still on the reconnecting screen its really bothering me :/

> [{quoted}](name=AuraShines,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=PznAjzAk,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-01-23T03:57:41.943+0000)
>
> Ive been stuck on reconnecting screen after my game has finished when my game randomly dced and i cant get back onto normal home screen pls help

This has also happened to me and another i was duoing with......
Please fix servers riot. <3

Hey AuraShines,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

I think i have figured out on how to fix it but it might take a while like around 20 minutes or so. U have to go on to ur client then click the ? then click on the restart and ur lol should starting updating after it has done updating u can play league again

I'm having this problem also atm. I was in game, when I got the attempting to reconnect message. It continued for several minutes, so I tried restarting my client, but when I try to reconnect I get a black screen, then this message: http://i.imgur.com/uU77qQ4.png 

The same thing happens again if I click retry. I have restarted my computer, and more than an hour has gone by since I was disconnected from my game, so it should have ended by now.

Here's one of my netlogs: 
> 2016-01-23T13-58-21: LogOut_File: : logfile started
2016-01-23T13-58-21: Net Status: low-level initialize success.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: Note that this new version (12/19/2011) has reduced the frequency of updates so the numbers will be larger
2016-01-23T13-58-21: time = time of logging
2016-01-23T13-58-21: address = address of IP address
2016-01-23T13-58-21: incoming = total size of messages set to me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: outgoing = total size of messages set from me in bytes. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: app_ctos = client to server bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
2016-01-23T13-58-21: app_stoc = server to client bytes delta excluding overheads (app data only)
2016-01-23T13-58-21: loss = number of packets lost. Can indicate lags.  Some node on the network is dropping packets or taking to long and we have to resend them.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: sent = number of packets sent. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: ping = how long it takes for a packet to get back and forth. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: variance = how much the ping is changing from avg ping. Spikes can indicate lag.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: reliable delayed = This occurs when we drop reliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data. Unreliable are more likely to be dropped than reliable.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: unreliable delayed = This occurs when we drop unreliable packets from sending this frame because we are sending to much data.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: app update delayed = This occurs when the app is taking to long to run code caused by network packets (ie CPU) and packets are delayed until the next frame
2016-01-23T13-58-21: Time spent in critical section (frame) = This is the time the network thread is blocking the main thread from doing anything.
2016-01-23T13-58-21: [time], [address], [incoming], [outgoing], [app_ctos], [app_stoc], [loss], [sent], [ping], [variance], [reliable delayed], [unreliable delayed], [app update delayed], [Time spent in critical section (frame)]
2016-01-23T13-59-42: Unknown enet peer disconected.
2016-01-23T14-01-39: Memory Allocations 
 Current Allocations = 1 
 Total Allocations = 8 
 Max Allocations = 5 
 Out of Pool Allocations = 4 
 Out of Pool dealloc = 4 

>2016-01-23T14-01-39: LogOut_File: : logfile stopped

Having the same fucking issues but they've been going longer. Dc'd while take a turret. Tried numerous times to reconnect only to have the game crash. 
Failing that I restarted the client to no avail.
Failing that I restarted the computer to no avail.
I ended up shutting down, taking apart and cleaning my comp.
Restarted comp and client. 
Game is still playing apparently.
BUT I'm still being booted.
So my question is this.
The fuck man?{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Also because the error is not just in my case but reported by and probably being experienced by other players, that a point should be awarded to anyone enlisted and playing the ocean week event when the game crashed. 
Failing that extend the event so everyone has a fair chance to earn their prizes.
I just started a new job this week and not being able to play my favorite game and enjoy the event to it's optimal level is pissing me off.
